text: Beavercreek is an unincorporated hamlet and a census-designated place (CDP) in Clackamas County, Oregon, United States. The population was 4,727 at the 2020 census. The term "Beaver Creek" was originally used to a local school district in the early 1850s, according to Oregon Geographic Names. The creek that runs through the neighborhood and empties into the Willamette River inspired the name. Prior to being renamed Beavercreek in 1922—a name that is still in use today—a post office in the area operated under a number of names. The ZIP code for Beavercreek is 97004. == References == Category:Hamlets in the United States Category:Census-designated places in Oregon Category:Unincorporated communities in Oregon
title: Beavercreek, Oregon
